recipes.name: Spicy Chicken Tikka Masala
recipes.description: Creamy Indian curry with spiced grilled chicken chunks in tomato sauce.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for 1 hour.
Grill chicken until slightly charred.
Simmer tomato sauce and add grilled chicken.
Stir in cream and simmer for 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Mission-Style Carne Asada Burrito
recipes.description: A massive, tightly wrapped burrito originating from San Francisco, loaded with grilled steak, Mexican rice, beans, salsa, and condiments.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked Mexican rice (prepared with tomato, onion, and garlic)
2 cups cooked pinto beans, slightly mashed
1 cup fresh Pico de Gallo (diced tomato, onion, cilantro, lime)
1 cup sour cream or Mexican crema
1 cup shredded Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese
instructions: Marinate the steak in lime juice, minced garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper for at least 30 minutes.
Grill the steak over high heat for 4-5 minutes per side until charred and medium-rare. Let it rest, then slice thinly against the grain.
Warm the tortillas on a griddle or over a gas flame until soft and pliable.
Layer ingredients in the center of each tortilla: a scoop of rice, a scoop of beans, a generous portion of steak, cheese, Pico de Gallo, a dollop of sour cream, and guacamole.
Fold the sides of the tortilla inward, then tightly roll from the bottom up, enclosing the filling completely.
Wrap tightly in foil to hold its shape. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Tacos al Pastor
recipes.description: Thinly sliced, marinated pork stacked on a vertical spit (like shawarma) and served on small corn tortillas with pineapple, onion, and cilantro.
ingredients: 5-6 dried guajillo chiles, deseeded and soaked
1 small pineapple, peeled and sliced into rings
instructions: Blend the soaked guajillo chiles, pineapple juice, vinegar, garlic, cumin, oregano, pepper, cloves, and salt into a smooth marinade (adobo).
Coat the sliced pork thoroughly in the marinade and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight.

If you have a vertical spit, stack the meat with pineapple slices on top. Alternatively, pan-fry or grill the marinated meat slices until cooked through and slightly charred. Grill the pineapple rings separately.
Warm the corn tortillas on a comal or skillet.
Chop the cooked pork and grilled pineapple into small pieces.
Serve the meat on tortillas, topped with chopped onion, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice.

recipes.name: Chicken Tamales with Red Sauce
recipes.description: A traditional Mesoamerican dish of seasoned masa (corn dough) stuffed with savory fillings, wrapped in a corn husk, and steamed.
ingredients: 1 package dried corn husks, soaked in hot water for 2 hours
4 cups masa harina (instant corn flour for tamales)
For the Filling: 2 cups shredded cooked chicken, 2 cups red chili sauce (made from soaked ancho/guajillo chiles, blended)
instructions: Beat the lard/shortening with an electric mixer until light and fluffy, about 3-5 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix the masa harina, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add the warm broth and mix until a soft dough forms.
Gradually incorporate the masa dough into the whipped lard, beating until the mixture has a light, spreadable consistency (a small ball of dough should float in a glass of water).
Pat a soaked corn husk dry. Spread a thin layer of masa dough (about 2 tbsp) in the center of the smooth side of the husk, leaving a border.
Spoon a line of shredded chicken and red sauce down the center of the masa.
Fold one long side of the husk over the filling, then the other side over that. Fold the bottom (pointed end) up. Leave the top open.
Stand the tamales upright, folded-end down, in a steamer pot. Steam for 60-90 minutes over simmering water, until the masa pulls away from the husk easily.
Let rest for 15 minutes before unwrapping and serving.

recipes.name: Pani Puri
recipes.description: Crispy hollow puris with tangy tamarind water.
ingredients: 2 tbsp boondi (tiny fried gram flour balls)
instructions: Prepare the pani: Blend cilantro, mint, green chilies, cumin powder, black salt, and 3 cups water into a smooth liquid. Strain and chill.
Prepare the filling: Mix mashed potatoes, chickpeas, chaat masala, and salt.
Just before serving, gently crack the top of each puri shell to make a hole.
Fill each puri with a spoonful of potato mixture and some chopped onions.
Add a few drops of tamarind chutney into each puri.
Dip the filled puri into the chilled pani and eat immediately in one bite.

recipes.name: Masala Dosa
recipes.description: Crispy fermented crepe with spiced potatoes.
ingredients: For Masala Filling: 4 potatoes (boiled & mashed), 1 onion (sliced), 1 tsp mustard seeds, 2-3 green chilies (slit), a pinch of asafoetida, turmeric powder, curry leaves
instructions: Soak rice, dal, and fenugreek seeds for 6 hours. Grind into a smooth batter, add salt, and let ferment overnight.
For filling: Heat oil, add mustard seeds. Once they pop, add curry leaves, green chilies, and asafoetida.
Add onions, sauté until soft. Add turmeric, then mashed potatoes. Mix well and set aside.
Heat a griddle, pour a ladle of batter, and spread in a circular motion to form a thin crepe.
Drizzle oil around the edges. Cook until crisp and golden.
Place a portion of potato masala on one half and fold the dosa over. Serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

recipes.name: Vegetable Thali
recipes.description: A complete platter of diverse flavors.
ingredients: 1 cup dal (lentil curry) - toor dal or moong dal
1 cup vegetable curry (e.g., aloo gobi or mix veg)
1 small bowl kheer (rice pudding) or halwa
Ghee, salt, turmeric, cumin, coriander, chili powder, garam masala
instructions: Cook basmati rice until fluffy and keep warm.
Prepare the dal: Pressure cook lentils with turmeric, then temper with cumin, garlic, and tomatoes.
Prepare one vegetable curry of your choice (e.g., potato and cauliflower).
Prepare raita by mixing yogurt with grated cucumber, roasted cumin powder, and salt.
Warm the chapatis on a tawa just before serving.
Arrange all components in small bowls on a large metal plate. Serve the sweet dessert (kheer) in a separate bowl.

recipes.name: Ceviche Clásico
recipes.description: Peru's iconic national dish of citrus-cured fish.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs very fresh, firm white fish (Sea Bass, Flounder, or Sole), cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1 aji limo or habanero pepper, seeded and finely minced (adjust to taste)
1 cup freshly squeezed key lime juice (approx. 20-25 limes)
1 large sweet potato, boiled and sliced
1 ear of corn, boiled and cut into rounds
instructions: Place the sliced red onion in a bowl of ice water for 10 minutes to soften its sharpness. Drain well.
In a large glass bowl, combine the cubed fish, minced garlic, and half of the minced aji limo pepper.
Pour the fresh key lime juice over the fish mixture. The juice should almost cover the fish. Gently mix.
Season generously with salt and stir. The fish will begin to turn opaque as it "cooks" in the acid.
Let it marinate for 10-15 minutes in the refrigerator. Do not marinate for too long, or the fish will become tough and overly acidic.
Just before serving, fold in the drained red onions and most of the chopped cilantro.
Taste and add more salt or minced pepper if needed.
Serve immediately on a bed of lettuce leaves, garnished with slices of boiled sweet potato, corn on the cob, and remaining cilantro.

recipes.name: Rocoto Relleno
recipes.description: Spicy peppers stuffed with savory meat filling.
ingredients: 4 large rocoto peppers (or substitute red bell peppers if unavailable)
1 tbsp aji panca paste (Peruvian red pepper paste)
1/4 cup peanuts, raisins, and hard-boiled egg, chopped (traditional mix-ins)
1 cup queso fresco or feta cheese, crumbled
instructions: **To prepare the peppers:** Wear gloves. Cut the tops off the rocotos and carefully remove the seeds and veins (the source of the heat). Blanch the peppers in boiling water for 5-7 minutes to reduce their spiciness. Drain and set aside.
**Make the filling:** Heat oil in a pan. Sauté onion and garlic until soft. Add aji panca paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add the ground beef and pork, breaking it up with a spoon. Cook until browned. Season with cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Stir in the peanuts, raisins, and chopped hard-boiled egg. Remove from heat.
**Assemble:** Carefully stuff the blanched rocoto peppers with the meat mixture.
**Make the topping:** In a bowl, whisk together the evaporated milk, crumbled cheese, and eggs until smooth.
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish. Pour the milk and egg mixture over the top.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and bubbly.
Let rest for 5-10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Papa a la Huancaína
recipes.description: Boiled potatoes in creamy spicy cheese sauce.
ingredients: 6-8 medium yellow potatoes (Yukon Gold work well)
2-3 aji amarillo (yellow Peruvian pepper), seeded and deveined (or 2 tbsp aji amarillo paste)
instructions: Boil the potatoes in their skins until tender when pierced with a fork. Let them cool, then peel and slice into thick rounds.
**Make the sauce:** In a blender, combine the queso fresco, aji amarillo, evaporated milk, oil, saltine crackers, garlic, and salt.
Blend until completely smooth and creamy. If the sauce is too thick, add a little more evaporated milk. It should be a pourable, creamy consistency. Taste and adjust salt.
To assemble, place a leaf of lettuce on a plate. Arrange the sliced potatoes on top.
Generously spoon the creamy Huancaína sauce over the potatoes, ensuring they are well covered.
Garnish with a slice of hard-boiled egg and a black olive on top.
Serve at room temperature or chilled.

recipes.name: Tonkotsu Ramen
recipes.description: Rich, creamy pork bone broth with chewy noodles.
ingredients: For the Broth: 2 kg pork femurs and neck bones, 200g pork fat back, 1 large onion, 1 head of garlic, 1 large piece of ginger, 2 green onions
For the Tare: 1 cup soy sauce, 1/2 cup mirin, 1/4 cup sake, 1 piece kombu, 5g bonito flakes
For the Bowls: 4 servings fresh ramen noodles, 400g chashu pork belly, 4 soft-boiled marinated ramen eggs, 100g menma, 2 sheets nori, 2 green onions, Beni shoga
instructions: Prepare the Broth: Rinse and boil bones for 10 mins to clean. Drain, scrub, and return to pot with 6L water. Boil vigorously for 12-18 hours until creamy and white, adding aromatics in the last hour. Strain.
Make the Tare: Combine soy, mirin, sake, and kombu. Heat until nearly boiling. Remove from heat, add bonito flakes, steep 10 mins, then strain.
Assemble the Bowls: Cook noodles until firm. Add 2-3 tbsp tare to each bowl. Ladle in hot broth. Add drained noodles.
Arrange toppings: chashu slices, a halved ramen egg, menma, nori, green onions, and beni shoga. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Nigiri Sushi
recipes.description: Hand-pressed vinegared rice topped with fresh fish.
ingredients: For Sushi Rice: 2 cups short-grain Japanese rice, 2 cups water, 50ml rice vinegar, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp salt, 1 piece kombu
For Toppings: 200g sashimi-grade tuna, sliced OR 200g sashimi-grade salmon, sliced OR 4-8 large raw prawns, peeled OR 4 pieces tamagoyaki
Other: Wasabi, Pickled ginger, Soy sauce
instructions: Cook the Rice: Wash rice until water runs clear. Soak for 30 mins. Cook with water and optional kombu.
Make Sushi Zu: Gently heat vinegar, sugar, and salt until dissolved. Cool.
Season Rice: Transfer hot rice to a wide bowl. Sprinkle vinegar mix over it. Fold and fan the rice simultaneously until glossy and cool. Cover with a damp cloth.
Prepare Toppings: Slice fish against the grain into 2x1x0.25 inch pieces.
Form Nigiri: Wet hands. Grab a 20g ball of rice and form an oblong base. Place a dab of wasabi on a fish slice. Press rice onto fish and shape with your fingers into a slight curve.
Serve immediately with pickled ginger and soy sauce.

recipes.name: Pan-Seared A5 Wagyu Steak
recipes.description: Perfectly seared, tender, buttery premium beef.
ingredients: 2 A5 Japanese Wagyu steaks Beef (200g each)
instructions: Let the Wagyu steaks sit at room temperature for 30-60 minutes, uncovered.
Pat the steaks completely dry with a paper towel.
Heat a heavy skillet (like cast iron) over medium heat. Do not add oil.
Generously season the steaks with coarse salt just before cooking.
Place steaks in the hot, dry pan. Sear for 1.5 - 2 minutes until a deep brown crust forms.
Flip the steak. Add optional smashed garlic to the rendered fat. Sear for another 1.5 - 2 minutes, basting optionally.
Remove from pan when internal temperature reaches 52-54°C (125-130°F) for medium-rare.
Place steak on a wire rack to rest for 5-10 minutes.
Slice thinly against the grain. Sprinkle with more salt and scallions. Serve with a lemon wedge.

recipes.name: Baklava
recipes.description: Layered nut pastry soaked in sweet syrup.
ingredients: For the Syrup: 2 cups sugar, 1 cup water, 1 cup honey, 1 tbsp lemon juice
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Butter a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Mix chopped nuts with cinnamon in a bowl.
Place one sheet of phyllo in the dish, brush lightly with melted butter. Repeat, layering 8 sheets.
Sprinkle a layer of the nut mixture over the phyllo.
Add 4 more buttered phyllo sheets, then another layer of nuts. Repeat until nuts are gone.
Top with 8 final layers of phyllo, buttering each sheet.
Cut baklava into diamonds or squares with a sharp knife.
Bake for 50 minutes until golden and crisp.
Meanwhile, make syrup: boil sugar and water until sugar dissolves. Add honey and lemon juice, simmer for 10 mins. Cool slightly.
Pour warm syrup over hot baklava right after removing from oven. Let cool completely before serving.

recipes.name: Ispanakli ve Peynirli Börek
recipes.description: Flaky filo pastry with cheese and spinach.
instructions: Sauté onion in olive oil until soft. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Let cool.
In a bowl, mix cooled spinach, crumbled feta, one egg, black pepper, and salt.
Brush a baking dish with melted butter.
Layer 4-5 sheets of phyllo in the dish, brushing each with butter.
Spread the spinach and cheese mixture evenly over the phyllo.
Continue layering another 4-5 phyllo sheets on top, buttering each one.
Beat the remaining egg and brush it over the top layer.
Score the top into portions before baking.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 30-35 minutes until golden brown and flaky.
Let cool for 10 minutes before cutting and serving.

recipes.name: Turkish Meze Platter
recipes.description: A spread of classic small appetizer dishes.
ingredients: For Hummus: 1 can chickpeas, 1/4 cup tahini, 2 cloves garlic, 3 tbsp lemon juice, 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, paprika
For Falafel: 1 can chickpeas, 1/2 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 3 tbsp parsley, 1 tsp cumin, 2 tbsp flour, oil for frying
For Haydari: 1 cup Greek yogurt, 1/2 cucumber grated, 1 clove garlic, 1 tbsp mint, salt
To Serve: Pita bread, olive oil, lemon wedges
instructions: Make Hummus: Drain chickpeas, reserve liquid. Blend chickpeas, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, and salt until smooth. Add reserved liquid to reach desired consistency. Drizzle with oil and paprika.
Make Falafel: Drain chickpeas. Blend with onion, garlic, parsley, cumin, and flour until coarse. Form into small patties. Fry in hot oil until golden brown, about 3-4 mins per side.
Make Haydari: Strain grated cucumber to remove water. Mix with yogurt, minced garlic, chopped mint, and salt.
Arrange hummus, falafel, and haydari on a platter. Drizzle with olive oil.
Serve immediately with warm pita bread and lemon wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Khao Niew Mamuang
recipes.description: Sweet sticky rice with fresh mango.
instructions: Soak the sticky rice in water for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight. Drain well.
Steam the drained rice in a bamboo steamer lined with cheesecloth for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
While rice is steaming, heat coconut milk in a saucepan over low heat. Add palm sugar and salt. Stir until dissolved. Do not boil.
Once rice is cooked, transfer to a bowl. Pour 3/4 of the warm coconut milk mixture over the hot rice. Gently fold to combine. Let it sit for 15 minutes to absorb the liquid.
If desired, heat the remaining coconut milk with a teaspoon of rice flour to create a slightly thicker sauce for topping.
To serve, place a portion of sticky rice on a plate, arrange mango slices alongside, and drizzle with the reserved coconut sauce. Garnish with toasted mung beans if using.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
recipes.description: Stir-fried rice noodles with tamarind sauce.
ingredients: 2 stalks garlic chives, cut into 1-inch pieces
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30-40 minutes until pliable but still firm. Drain.
Make the sauce by mixing tamarind paste, fish sauce, and palm sugar in a bowl until sugar dissolves.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add garlic and tofu, stir-fry until golden.
Push ingredients to one side, crack eggs into the wok and scramble.
Add drained noodles and the prepared sauce. Toss and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until noodles are tender and sauce is absorbed.
Add bean sprouts and garlic chives. Toss for another 30 seconds.
Serve immediately, garnished with crushed peanuts and a wedge of lime on the side.

recipes.name: Gaeng Keow Wan
recipes.description: Aromatic green curry in coconut milk.
ingredients: 2 tbsp green curry paste (store-bought or homemade)
instructions: Skim the thick cream from the top of the coconut milk can. Heat it in a wok or pot over medium heat.
Add green curry paste to the coconut cream and fry for 2-3 minutes until fragrant and oil separates.
Add chicken slices and stir-fry until they turn white on the outside.
Pour in the remaining coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add Thai eggplants (or zucchini) and kaffir lime leaves. Simmer for 10-12 minutes until vegetables are tender and chicken is cooked through.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar. Stir to combine.
Remove from heat and stir in Thai basil leaves.
Garnish with sliced red chilies. Serve immediately with steamed jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Gelato al Fiordilatte
recipes.description: Creamy, smooth Italian milk gelato.
ingredients: 20 g cornstarch (or 30g rice flour for stabilizer)
1/4 tsp vanilla extract (or seeds of 1/2 vanilla bean)
instructions: In a saucepan, whisk together the sugar, skim milk powder, and cornstarch until no lumps remain.
Gradually pour in the cold milk and cream while whisking constantly to prevent clumps.
Place the saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly with a spatula, until the mixture thickens enough to coat the back of the spoon (82-85°C / 180-185°F). Do not let it boil.
Immediately remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and salt.
Pour the custard (base) into a bowl set over an ice bath to cool it rapidly, stirring occasionally.
Once at room temperature, cover the surface directly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight, to mature.
Churn the chilled base in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions until it reaches a soft-serve consistency.
Transfer to an airtight container and freeze for 2-4 hours before serving to firm up.

recipes.name: Pasta alla Carbonara
recipes.description: Roman pasta with eggs, cheese, and guanciale.
ingredients: 100 g Pecorino Romano cheese, finely grated
instructions: Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil for the pasta.
In a bowl, whisk the egg yolks, whole egg, most of the grated cheese, and a generous amount of black pepper until smooth. Set aside.
In a large skillet, cook the diced guanciale over medium heat until crispy and the fat has rendered, about 5-7 minutes. Turn off the heat and let it cool slightly.
Cook the pasta until very al dente (firm to the bite). Reserve a cup of the starchy pasta water before draining.
Transfer the hot, drained pasta directly into the skillet with the guanciale and its fat.
Working quickly off the heat, toss the pasta to coat it in the fat.

Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing vigorously. If needed, add a small splash of the reserved hot pasta water to help emulsify and create a creamy sauce that coats the pasta without scrambling the eggs.
Serve immediately, topped with the remaining grated cheese and more black pepper.

recipes.name: Risotto alla Milanese
recipes.description: Creamy saffron risotto from Milan.
ingredients: 320 g Carnaroli or Vialone Nano rice
1.5 liters hot chicken or vegetable stock
instructions: Keep the stock simmering in a separate pot next to your risotto pan.
Steep the saffron threads in a small ladleful of the hot stock to release its color and flavor.
In a wide, heavy-bottomed pan (a *casseruola*), melt half of the butter over medium heat. Add the minced onion and cook until soft and translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the rice and toast it for about 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the grains are translucent around the edges.
Pour in the white wine and stir until it is fully absorbed by the rice.
Begin adding the hot stock, one ladleful at a time. Stir constantly and only add the next ladle once the previous one has been mostly absorbed.
After about 15 minutes, pour in the saffron-infused stock along with its threads.
Continue adding stock and stirring for another 5-7 minutes, until the rice is *al dente* and the risotto has a creamy, flowing consistency.
Remove from heat. Vigorously stir in the remaining cold butter and the grated Parmigiano-Reggiano. This step, called *mantecatura*, is key for creaminess.
Cover and let it rest for 1-2 minutes. Adjust salt if needed. Serve immediately on warm plates.

recipes.name: Jiaozi (Chinese Dumplings)
recipes.description: Savory pork-filled dough parcels, pan-fried.
ingredients: 250g ground pork (with some fat) OR Chicken
Soy sauce, black vinegar, chili oil for dipping
instructions: Make the dough: Mix flour and salt. Gradually add warm water, stirring until a shaggy dough forms. Knead on a floured surface for 5-7 mins until smooth. Cover with a damp cloth and rest for 30 mins.
Prepare filling: Sprinkle salt over chopped cabbage and let sit for 10 mins. Squeeze out excess water thoroughly.
In a large bowl, combine ground pork, cabbage, green onions, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, sesame oil, and white pepper. Mix vigorously in one direction until the filling is cohesive.
Assemble dumplings: Roll the dough into a long log and cut into 40 pieces. Roll each piece into a thin, round wrapper (about 3-inch diameter), keeping the center slightly thicker than the edges.
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of a wrapper. Fold and pleat the edges to seal tightly. Ensure no air is trapped inside.
To pan-fry (classic potsticker method): Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Arrange dumplings in a single layer, flat side down. Fry for 2-3 mins until golden brown on the bottom.
Carefully pour in 1/2 cup water, cover immediately, and steam for 6-8 mins until water evaporates and dumpling skins are translucent.
Uncover and cook for another 1-2 mins to crisp the bottoms again. Serve immediately with a dipping sauce of soy sauce, black vinegar, and chili oil.

recipes.name: Chicken Shawarma Wraps
recipes.description: Spiced grilled chicken in soft flatbread.
ingredients: Tahini sauce or garlic yogurt sauce
instructions: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, minced garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, paprika, cumin, turmeric, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Mix well to create a marinade.
Add the chicken thighs to the marinade, ensuring each piece is thoroughly coated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight for best results.
Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade, letting excess drip off.
Cook the chicken for 5-7 minutes per side, or until fully cooked through and nicely charred on the outside.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes on a cutting board, then slice it into thin strips.
Warm the flatbreads lightly in a dry pan or microwave for 20 seconds to make them pliable.
To assemble, spread a tablespoon of hummus down the center of each flatbread.
Place a generous amount of sliced chicken on top of the hummus.
Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomato, and cucumber slices.
Drizzle with tahini or garlic yogurt sauce. Fold the sides of the flatbread over the filling, then roll it up tightly from the bottom. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Beef Kofta Kebabs with Rice
recipes.description: Spiced ground beef skewers with fluffy rice.
instructions: If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for 30 minutes to prevent burning.
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, grated onion, minced garlic, parsley, cumin, coriander, allspice, salt, and pepper. Mix with your hands until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
Take a handful of the meat mixture and mold it firmly onto a skewer in a long, sausage-like shape, about 1-inch thick. Repeat with the remaining meat.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Lightly oil the grates.
Place the kofta kebabs on the grill. Cook for 4-5 minutes on each side, turning occasionally, until they are browned and cooked through.
Remove the kebabs from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
Serve the hot kofta kebabs over a bed of fluffy basmati rice with a side of lemon wedges and a dollop of cool yogurt.

recipes.name: Creamy Coconut Lentil Curry
recipes.description: Hearty lentils simmered in spiced coconut sauce.
ingredients: 1 cup brown or green lentils, rinsed
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté for 5 minutes until softened.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger, and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Stir in the curry powder and turmeric, toasting the spices for 30 seconds.
Add the rinsed lentils, diced tomato, coconut milk, and vegetable broth to the pot. Stir everything together.
Bring the curry to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for 35-40 minutes, or until the lentils are tender. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Once the lentils are soft and the curry has thickened, season with salt to taste.
Serve the curry hot, garnished with fresh chopped cilantro and a wedge of lime on the side for squeezing over the top.

recipes.name: Sheet Pan Lemon Herb Salmon
recipes.description: Baked salmon and veggies with lemon herbs.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
On a large sheet pan, toss the halved baby potatoes with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread them in an even layer.
Roast the potatoes for 15 minutes, until they start to become tender.
While the potatoes are roasting, pat the salmon fillets dry and season both sides with salt, pepper, dill, and oregano.
After 15 minutes, remove the sheet pan from the oven. Push the potatoes to one side.
Place the salmon fillets in the center of the pan. Arrange the asparagus and lemon slices around the salmon.
Drizzle the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over the asparagus and lemon slices, and season with a pinch of salt.
Return the sheet pan to the oven and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve immediately directly from the pan, squeezing the roasted lemon slices over everything.

recipes.name: One-Pan Harissa Chicken & Veggies
recipes.description: Spicy roasted chicken with colorful vegetables.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a small bowl, mix the harissa paste, olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Pat the chicken thighs dry with a paper towel. Rub the harissa mixture all over the chicken, ensuring it's fully coated, including under the skin.
Place the sliced bell peppers and red onion wedges in a large baking dish. Toss them with a pinch of salt.
Nestle the coated chicken thighs, skin-side up, amongst the vegetables in the baking dish.
Roast in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the chicken skin is crispy and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C), and the vegetables are tender and slightly charred.
Remove from the oven and let the chicken rest for 5 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Classic Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
recipes.description: Simple garlic spaghetti with chili flakes.
ingredients: 1 tsp red chili flakes (adjust to taste)
instructions: Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook according to package directions until al dente.
While the pasta cooks, heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium-low heat.

Add the thinly sliced garlic and chili flakes to the oil. Cook gently for 3-4 minutes, stirring frequently, until the garlic is fragrant and lightly golden. Do not let it burn, or it will turn bitter.
Once the pasta is cooked, reserve 1/2 cup of the starchy pasta water, then drain the spaghetti.
Add the drained pasta directly to the pan with the garlic oil. Toss vigorously to coat every strand.
If the pasta seems dry, add a splash of the reserved pasta water to help create a silky sauce that clings to the spaghetti.
Remove the pan from the heat. Stir in the freshly chopped parsley and toss one more time.
Taste and adjust seasoning with more salt if needed. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Hearty Beef and Vegetable Soup
recipes.description: Warming soup with tender beef chunks.
instructions: Pat the beef chunks dry and season generously with salt and pepper.
Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the beef in a single layer (work in batches if needed) and sear on all sides until browned. Remove the beef and set aside.
In the same pot, add the onion, carrots, and celery. Sauté for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables begin to soften.
Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Pour in the beef broth and diced tomatoes with their juices, scraping the bottom of the pot to release any browned bits.
Add the seared beef back into the pot, along with any accumulated juices. Stir in the bay leaves and dried thyme.
Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it simmer gently for at least 1 hour, or until the beef is very tender.
Before serving, remove the bay leaves. Season the soup with additional salt and pepper to taste. Ladle into bowls and serve hot.

recipes.name: Quick Chickpea and Spinach Stew
recipes.description: Fast, flavorful vegan stew with greens.
ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic, cumin, and smoked paprika. Stir and cook for 1 minute until the spices are fragrant.
Add the drained chickpeas, diced tomatoes (with their juice), and vegetable broth. Stir to combine.
Bring the stew to a simmer and let it cook for 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Stir in the fresh spinach, a handful at a time, and cook until it has wilted down completely, about 2-3 minutes.
Season the stew generously with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the stew hot in bowls, with a wedge of lemon on the side for squeezing over the top to add brightness.

recipes.name: Turkish Lamb Pide (Turkish Pizza)
recipes.description: Boat-shaped flatbread with spiced lamb.
instructions: Make the dough: In a bowl, combine warm water, yeast, and sugar. Let it sit for 5-10 mins until foamy.
In a large bowl, mix flour and salt. Pour in the yeast mixture and olive oil. Mix to form a dough.
Knead on a floured surface for 5-7 mins until smooth. Place in an oiled bowl, cover, and let rise for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 475°F (240°C). Punch down the dough and divide into 2 equal pieces. Roll each into an oval shape about 1/4-inch thick.
Create a "boat" by pinching the edges to form a thick crust. Transfer the dough ovals to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Make the filling: In a skillet, cook the ground lamb over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add the chopped onion and garlic to the lamb. Cook for 5 mins until soft. Stir in the tomato, paprika, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 2 mins. Remove from heat.
Divide the lamb mixture between the two dough boats, spreading it evenly within the raised edges.
Brush the edges of the dough with the egg yolk and sprinkle with sesame seeds if desired.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and cooked through. Slice and serve hot.

recipes.name: Simple Chicken Fried Rice
recipes.description: Easy homemade takeout-style fried rice.
instructions: Heat half of the vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add the diced chicken and cook until no longer pink and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the wok and set aside.
Add the remaining oil to the wok. Add the minced garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Push the garlic to one side. Pour the beaten eggs into the other side and scramble them, breaking them into small pieces as they cook.
Add the frozen peas and carrots to the wok. Stir-fry for 2 minutes until they are heated through.
Add the cooled, cooked rice to the wok. Use your spatula to break up any clumps. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the rice is hot.
Return the cooked chicken to the wok. Pour the soy sauce and sesame oil over the rice.
Continue to stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, ensuring everything is well combined and heated through.
Turn off the heat and stir in the sliced green onions. Serve the fried rice immediately while hot.

recipes.name: Classic Beef Shepherd's Pie
recipes.description: Hearty minced beef topped with creamy mash.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Boil potatoes in salted water for 15-20 minutes until tender. Drain well.
Mash the potatoes with warm milk and butter until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
While potatoes cook, heat oil in a large oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté onion and carrots for 5 mins until softened. Add garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
Add ground beef, breaking it up with a spoon. Cook until browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Add beef stock, Worcestershire sauce, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until sauce thickens slightly.
Stir in frozen peas. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Spread the mashed potato evenly over the beef mixture. Fluff the top with a fork. Sprinkle with cheese if using.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the topping is golden and the filling is bubbling. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Easy Vegetable Stir-Fry Noodles
recipes.description: Quick noodles with colorful crunchy vegetables.
ingredients: 250g dried egg noodles or rice noodles
instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking. Toss with a little oil to prevent sticking.
Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the harder vegetables first: broccoli and carrot. Stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining vegetables: bell pepper and snap peas. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Push vegetables to one side. Add the cooked noodles to the center of the wok.
Pour soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper over the noodles. Toss everything together quickly to combine and heat through.
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Moroccan Chickpea & Apricot Tagine
recipes.description: Sweet and savory stew with couscous.
ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, coriander, paprika, cinnamon, and cayenne. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in chickpeas, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and dried apricots. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and let it cook for 20-25 minutes, allowing flavors to meld. Season with salt and pepper.
Meanwhile, prepare couscous. Place couscous in a heatproof bowl. Pour 1 cup of boiling water over it, cover, and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
Serve the tagine hot over the fluffy couscous, garnished with fresh cilantro.

recipes.name: Crispy Baked Chicken Tenders
recipes.description: Oven-baked crispy tenders with dipping sauce.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil or melted butter
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place a wire rack on top. Spray the rack with cooking spray.
Set up three shallow bowls: one with flour mixed with paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. One with beaten eggs. One with panko breadcrumbs mixed with the olive oil.
Pat chicken tenders dry. Dredge each tender first in the flour mixture, shaking off excess.
Dip next into the beaten egg, allowing excess to drip off.
Finally, press firmly into the panko mixture, ensuring an even coating.
Place the coated tenders on the prepared wire rack. This ensures they get crispy all around.
Bake for 15-18 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown, crispy, and cooked through.
Serve immediately with your favorite dipping sauces like honey mustard or ketchup.

recipes.name: Spanish Garlic Prawns (Gambas al Ajillo)
recipes.description: Sizzling prawns in garlic olive oil.
ingredients: 500g large raw prawns, peeled and deveined
1-2 dried red chilies, crumbled (or 1 tsp chili flakes)
instructions: Pat the prawns completely dry with paper towels and season lightly with salt.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or ceramic dish over medium heat.
Add the garlic and chilies. Cook for 1-2 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant and just starting to turn golden. Do not let it burn.
Increase the heat to medium-high. Add the prawns in a single layer. Cook for 1-2 minutes per side, until they turn pink and are just cooked through.
Remove from heat immediately. Stir in the fresh parsley and a generous squeeze of lemon juice.
Serve immediately straight from the skillet, with plenty of crusty bread to soak up the delicious garlic oil.

recipes.name: Hearty Lentil and Vegetable Soup
recipes.description: Comforting and nutritious lentil soup.
ingredients: 1.5 cups brown or green lentils, rinsed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook for 5-7 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add rinsed lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, thyme, and bay leaf. Stir to combine.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 35-40 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Remove the bay leaf. Stir in the kale or spinach and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice. Season generously with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with an extra drizzle of olive oil on top.

recipes.name: Easy Margherita Flatbread Pizza
recipes.description: Simple homemade pizza on flatbread.
ingredients: 1/2 cup pizza sauce or tomato puree
Extra virgin olive oil for drizzling
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Place flatbreads on a baking sheet. Lightly toast them in the oven for 3 minutes to crisp up.
Remove from oven. Spread a thin layer of pizza sauce over each flatbread, leaving a small border.
Sprinkle with minced garlic. Top with shredded mozzarella cheese.
Arrange tomato slices on top. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted, bubbly, and starting to brown.
Remove from oven and immediately top with fresh basil leaves. Drizzle with olive oil.
Slice and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Japanese Chicken Teriyaki Donburi
recipes.description: Grilled chicken glazed with teriyaki sauce.
ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp water (slurry)
instructions: Pat chicken thighs dry and season with salt and pepper.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Place chicken thighs skin-side down (if using) and cook for 5-6 minutes until golden brown. Flip and cook for another 5-6 minutes until cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add soy sauce, mirin, sake, brown sugar, ginger, and garlic. Bring to a simmer, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
Add the cornstarch slurry and whisk until the sauce thickens, about 1-2 minutes.
Return the chicken to the skillet, turning to coat generously in the teriyaki glaze.
Slice the glazed chicken.
To serve, divide rice among bowls. Top with sliced teriyaki chicken and steamed broccoli. Drizzle with extra glaze from the pan. Garnish with sesame seeds.

recipes.name: Creamy Mushroom and Thyme Pasta
recipes.description: Elegant pasta in a rich mushroom sauce.
ingredients: 1/2 cup white wine or vegetable broth
1 cup heavy cream (or coconut cream for dairy-free)
instructions: Cook pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
While pasta cooks, heat butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add mushrooms and cook, without stirring too much, until they release their water and become golden brown, about 8-10 minutes.
Add shallot and garlic, cook for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Pour in white wine (or broth) to deglaze the pan, scraping up any browned bits. Let it simmer until reduced by half.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in cream and thyme. Bring to a gentle simmer. Do not boil. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the drained pasta directly to the skillet along with Parmesan cheese (if using). Toss to coat, adding a splash of reserved pasta water if needed to loosen the sauce.
Garnish with fresh parsley and extra black pepper. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Thai Green Curry with Vegetables
recipes.description: Aromatic coconut curry with fresh vegetables.
ingredients: 1 tbsp fish sauce (or soy sauce for vegetarian)
1 cup green beans, trimmed and halved
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pot over medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the thick coconut cream from the top of the can. Fry for 1 minute.
Add green curry paste. Fry for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, until very fragrant.
Pour in the remaining coconut milk, vegetable broth, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Stir to combine and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add the harder vegetables first: eggplant and green beans. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the remaining vegetables: bell pepper and bamboo shoots. Simmer for another 5-7 minutes, until all vegetables are tender but still crisp.
Stir in Thai basil and kaffir lime leaves (if using). Cook for 1 more minute.
Taste and adjust seasoning with more fish sauce or sugar if needed.
Serve immediately over jasmine rice, with lime wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Egyptian Koshari
recipes.description: National dish of Egypt with lentils and rice.
ingredients: 1 cup elbow macaroni or ditalini pasta
instructions: Cook the lentils: In a medium pot, combine rinsed lentils with 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until tender but not mushy. Drain and set aside.

Cook the rice: In the same pot, combine the rinsed rice with 1.5 cups of water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, stir once, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let it steam, covered, for 10 more minutes. Fluff with a fork.
Cook the pasta: In a separate pot, cook the macaroni according to package directions in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.

Caramelize the onions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and cook, stirring frequently, for 15-20 minutes until deeply browned and crispy. Remove onions with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined plate, leaving the oil in the skillet.

Make the tomato sauce: Add minced garlic to the oil in the skillet. Cook for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add crushed tomatoes, vinegar, cumin, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until slightly thickened.
Heat the chickpeas: In a small saucepan, heat the drained chickpeas with a little water or a splash of the tomato sauce until warm.
Assemble the dish: In a large serving platter or individual bowls, create layers: first the rice, then the lentils, followed by the pasta.
Top with the warm chickpeas and a generous amount of tomato sauce.
Garnish with the crispy caramelized onions and fresh chopped cilantro. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Vietnamese Caramel Ginger Chicken (Ga Kho)
recipes.description: Savory sweet chicken braised in caramel sauce.
instructions: In a bowl, marinate chicken thighs with 1 tbsp fish sauce and black pepper for 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a deep skillet or clay pot over medium heat. Add sugar and melt until it becomes a dark amber caramel (about 3-4 minutes).
Carefully add chicken pieces (skin side down) and sear for 2-3 minutes per side until browned.
Add garlic, ginger, and shallot. Stir for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add remaining fish sauce and coconut water. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to low.
Cover and simmer for 25-30 minutes until chicken is tender and sauce has reduced.
Uncover and cook for another 5 minutes to thicken the sauce further.
Garnish with sliced chilies and spring onion. Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Persian Jeweled Rice (Javaher Polow)
recipes.description: Fragrant basmati rice with nuts and fruits.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp saffron threads, dissolved in 3 tbsp hot water
instructions: Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear. Soak in salted water for 30 minutes, then drain.
In a pot, bring 8 cups water to boil. Add rice and cook for 6-7 minutes until parboiled. Drain.
Melt 1 tbsp butter in a skillet. Add carrots and sauté for 3-4 minutes. Add nuts and dried fruits, sauté for another 2 minutes. Set aside.
In a non-stick pot, melt remaining butter. Spread half of the rice in the pot. Sprinkle with half of the spice mixture.
Spread all of the fruit-nut mixture over the rice. Top with remaining rice.
Pour saffron water over the rice. Cover with lid wrapped in cloth and cook on low heat for 45-50 minutes.
Once done, gently fluff the rice and transfer to serving platter, ensuring the jeweled layer is visible.
Serve as a side with grilled meats or stews.

recipes.name: Ethiopian Red Lentil Stew (Misir Wot)
recipes.description: Spicy lentil stew with Ethiopian berbere spice.
ingredients: 1/4 cup niter kibbeh (spiced butter) or regular butter
instructions: Melt niter kibbeh or butter in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown (about 10 minutes).
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add berbere spice and paprika, stirring constantly for 1 minute.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add rinsed lentils and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30-35 minutes until lentils are tender, stirring occasionally.
Add salt to taste. If too thick, add more broth or water.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with injera bread or rice.

recipes.name: Portuguese Grilled Sardines (Sardinhas Assadas)
recipes.description: Simple grilled sardines with lemon and herbs.
instructions: Rinse sardines and pat dry with paper towels.
In a bowl, mix olive oil, garlic, lemon juice and zest, paprika, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Brush the sardines generously with the marinade, both inside and out.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Oil the grill grates.
Grill sardines for 3-4 minutes per side until skin is crispy and flesh flakes easily.
Remove from grill and drizzle with remaining marinade.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges and crusty bread.

recipes.name: Korean Soy Glazed Potatoes (Gamja Bokkeum)
recipes.description: Sweet and savory glazed potato side dish.
ingredients: 1 tbsp rice syrup or corn syrup
instructions: Soak cubed potatoes in cold water for 10 minutes to remove starch. Drain and pat dry.
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes and cook until golden brown (about 10 minutes).
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, rice syrup, sesame oil, and garlic.
Add the sauce mixture and water to the potatoes. Stir to coat.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 8-10 minutes until potatoes are tender.
Uncover and cook until sauce thickens and glazes the potatoes.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions. Serve as a banchan (side dish).

recipes.name: Lebanese Fattoush Salad
recipes.description: Fresh herb salad with toasted pita chips.
ingredients: 2 large pita breads, toasted and broken into chips
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Cut pita bread into triangles, spread on baking sheet, and toast for 10 minutes until crisp.
In a large bowl, combine lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, bell pepper, red onion, mint, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, pomegranate molasses, sumac, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Add pita chips just before serving to maintain crispness.
Serve immediately as a refreshing side dish.

recipes.name: Peruvian Green Sauce (Aji Verde)
recipes.description: Creamy spicy sauce for grilled meats and vegetables.
ingredients: 1/4 cup cotija cheese or feta cheese
1/4 cup sour cream or Greek yogurt
instructions: Combine cilantro, jalapeños, and garlic in a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped.
Add cheese, mayonnaise, sour cream, lime juice, and olive oil. Process until smooth.
With processor running, slowly add water until desired consistency is reached.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Serve with grilled chicken, steak, roasted vegetables, or as a sandwich spread.

recipes.name: Hungarian Mushroom Soup
recipes.description: Creamy paprika mushroom soup with dill.
instructions: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and become golden brown.
Add garlic, paprika, and caraway seeds. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Sprinkle flour over mushrooms and stir to coat. Cook for 2 minutes.
Gradually add vegetable broth, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in milk or cream and heat through (do not boil).
Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice and dill.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream and extra dill.

recipes.name: Malaysian Roti Canai with Curry Dip
recipes.description: Flaky flatbread with spicy curry dipping sauce.
instructions: Mix flour, water, egg, condensed milk, and salt to form a soft dough. Knead for 10 minutes until smooth.
Divide dough into 6 balls. Coat each ball with ghee and let rest for 2 hours.
For curry: Sauté onions until soft. Add curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add potatoes, coconut milk, broth, and tamarind. Simmer until potatoes are tender.
Stretch each dough ball until paper thin. Fold into square and pan-fry in ghee until golden.
Shred the roti canai before serving with curry dip.

recipes.name: Jamaican Jerk Spice Blend
recipes.description: Authentic Jamaican jerk seasoning mix.
instructions: Grind allspice berries in spice grinder or mortar and pestle.
Combine with all remaining ingredients in a bowl.
Mix thoroughly until well combined.
Store in airtight container for up to 6 months.
Use as dry rub for chicken, pork, fish, or tofu before grilling or roasting.

recipes.name: Filipino Chicken Adobo
recipes.description: Tangy, savory chicken braised in vinegar and soy sauce.
ingredients: 1 tbsp coconut oil or vegetable oil
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chicken, soy sauce, half of the crushed garlic, and peppercorns. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.

Heat oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinade (reserve marinade) and sear, skin-side down, until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Work in batches to avoid overcrowding. Remove chicken and set aside.
In the same pot, add the remaining garlic and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Return the chicken to the pot. Pour in the reserved marinade, vinegar, water, and add the bay leaves. Bring to a boil.
Once boiling, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30-35 minutes, until the chicken is tender and cooked through.
Uncover, add brown sugar if using, and simmer for another 10-15 minutes to reduce the sauce slightly.
Serve hot over steamed rice, spooning the rich sauce over the top.

recipes.name: Swedish Meatballs (Köttbullar)
recipes.description: Tender meatballs in a creamy gravy sauce.
ingredients: Salt and white pepper to taste
instructions: In a small bowl, combine breadcrumbs and milk. Let sit for 5 minutes to absorb.
In a large bowl, mix ground meats, soaked breadcrumbs, grated onion, egg, allspice, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Mix with your hands until just combined.
Shape the mixture into small, bite-sized meatballs.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown the meatballs in batches, turning frequently, for about 5-7 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add flour and whisk to create a roux with the pan drippings. Cook for 1 minute.
Gradually whisk in the beef broth, ensuring no lumps form. Bring to a simmer until the sauce thickens.
Stir in the heavy cream and soy sauce. Return the meatballs to the skillet and simmer for another 5-10 minutes until cooked through.
Serve hot with mashed potatoes or egg noodles, and a dollop of lingonberry jam.

recipes.name: South African Bobotie
recipes.description: Spiced minced meat casserole with egg topping.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Soak bread in 1/2 cup of milk until soft.
Heat oil in a large pan. Sauté onions until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add ground meat and cook until browned. Drain excess fat.
Squeeze milk from bread and add bread to the meat mixture. Discard milk.
Stir in curry powder, apricot jam, raisins, almonds, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes.
Transfer mixture to a greased baking dish. Press down firmly and place bay leaves on top.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Whisk eggs with remaining 1/2 cup milk. Pour over the meat mixture.
Return to oven and bake for another 25-30 minutes until topping is set and golden.
Serve with yellow rice (rice cooked with turmeric).

recipes.name: Austrian Wiener Schnitzel
recipes.description: Crispy breaded veal or chicken cutlet.
ingredients: 4 veal escalopes or chicken breasts, pounded thin
1/2 cup clarified butter or neutral oil for frying
instructions: Place each cutlet between two pieces of plastic wrap and pound until very thin (about 1/4 inch).
Set up three shallow dishes: one with flour seasoned with salt and pepper, one with beaten eggs, and one with breadcrumbs.
Dredge each cutlet first in flour, shaking off excess. Then dip in egg, allowing excess to drip off. Finally, press firmly into breadcrumbs to coat evenly.
Heat a generous amount of butter or oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. The fat should be about 1/4 inch deep.
Fry the schnitzels one or two at a time for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy.
Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges and a sprinkle of fresh parsley. Traditionally served with potato salad or parsley potatoes.

recipes.name: Brazilian Cheese Bread (Pão de Queijo)
recipes.description: Gluten-free cheesy bread puffs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F). Grease a mini muffin tin.
In a saucepan, bring milk, oil, and salt to a boil.
Place tapioca flour in a large bowl. Pour the boiling milk mixture over the flour and stir until smooth. Let cool for 10 minutes.
Mix in eggs and cheese until well combined. The dough will be sticky and stretchy.
Scoop tablespoon-sized portions of dough into the prepared muffin tin.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until puffed and golden brown.
Serve warm. Best eaten fresh from the oven.

recipes.name: Armenian Lentil and Bulgur Soup (Vospov Kheyma)
recipes.description: Hearty lentil soup with bulgur and mint.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onion until translucent.
Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in lentils, bulgur, dried mint, paprika, and cumin.
Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes until lentils are soft.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing over the soup.

recipes.name: Polish Potato Pancakes (Placki Ziemniaczane)
recipes.description: Crispy shredded potato pancakes.
ingredients: Sour cream and applesauce for serving
instructions: Grate potatoes and onion on the fine side of a grater or use a food processor.
Place grated mixture in a clean kitchen towel and squeeze out as much liquid as possible.
In a bowl, mix squeezed potato-onion mixture with eggs, flour, salt, and pepper.
Heat a generous amount of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Drop spoonfuls of the mixture into the hot oil, flattening them into pancakes.
Fry for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve immediately with sour cream and applesauce.

recipes.name: Nigerian Jollof Rice
recipes.description: One-pot spicy tomato rice with vegetables.
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear. Soak in cold water for 30 minutes, then drain.
Heat oil in a large pot. Sauté onion until softened.
Add blended peppers and cook for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add tomato paste and cook for 5 more minutes.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, thyme, curry powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 10 minutes.
Add rice and stir to coat with the tomato mixture.
Pour in stock and add bay leaves. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add frozen vegetables, cover, and cook for another 10 minutes.
Fluff with fork and serve hot.

recipes.name: French Ratatouille
recipes.description: Provencal vegetable stew with herbs.
instructions: Salt eggplant and let sit for 30 minutes to draw out bitterness. Rinse and pat dry.
Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onion until translucent.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add eggplant and cook for 5 minutes until slightly softened.
Add remaining vegetables, herbes de Provence, and bay leaf.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and simmer over low heat for 40-45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove bay leaf before serving.
Garnish with fresh basil and serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Tunisian Egg Shakshuka
recipes.description: Eggs poached in spicy tomato pepper sauce.
ingredients: Fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Sauté onion and bell peppers until soft.
Add garlic and spices, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 15-20 minutes until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper.
Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook for 5-8 minutes until eggs are set to your liking.
Garnish with fresh herbs and feta cheese if using.
Serve immediately with crusty bread for dipping.

recipes.name: Greek Spanakopita (Spinach and Feta Pie)
recipes.description: Flaky phyllo pie filled with spinach and feta.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large pan. Sauté onion until soft, then add garlic and spinach. Cook until spinach wilts. Drain excess liquid and let cool.
In a bowl, combine spinach mixture, feta, eggs, dill, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Brush a baking dish with olive oil. Layer 4 sheets of phyllo pastry, brushing each with oil.
Spread the spinach mixture over the pastry. Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with oil.
Score the top layers into squares. Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden and crisp.
Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Indian Chana Masala
recipes.description: Spicy chickpea curry with aromatic spices.
ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat oil in a pot. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle.
Add onion and sauté until golden. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and spices (coriander, turmeric, garam masala, cayenne). Cook until oil separates.
Add chickpeas and 1 cup water. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Mexican Street Corn (Elote)
recipes.description: Grilled corn topped with creamy chili lime sauce.
instructions: Grill corn over medium heat until charred, turning occasionally.
Mix mayonnaise and sour cream in a bowl.
Brush the grilled corn with the mayo mixture.
Sprinkle with cotija cheese, chili powder, and salt.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with lime wedges.

recipes.name: Thai Mango Sticky Rice
recipes.description: Sweet coconut sticky rice with fresh mango.
instructions: Steam soaked rice for 20-25 minutes until tender.
Heat coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a saucepan until dissolved.
Pour half the coconut mixture over the cooked rice. Let it absorb for 20 minutes.
Serve rice with mango slices, drizzle with remaining coconut sauce, and sprinkle sesame seeds.

recipes.name: Italian Minestrone Soup
recipes.description: Hearty vegetable soup with pasta and beans.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery until soft.
Add garlic and zucchini, cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes, beans, broth, and oregano. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add pasta and cook until al dente.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with grated Parmesan.

recipes.name: Japanese Teriyaki Tofu Bowl
recipes.description: Pan-fried tofu with teriyaki sauce over rice.
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, pressed and cubed
instructions: Heat oil in a pan. Pan-fry tofu until golden on all sides.
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, mirin, honey, and ginger.
Pour sauce over tofu and simmer until glazed.
Serve tofu over rice with cucumber and avocado. Garnish with sesame seeds.

recipes.name: French Quiche Lorraine
recipes.description: Savory bacon and cheese tart in a flaky crust.
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Sprinkle bacon and cheese into the pie crust.
Whisk eggs, cream, milk, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Pour over bacon.
Bake for 35-40 minutes until set and golden.
Let cool for 10 minutes before slicing.

recipes.name: Moroccan Carrot and Chickpea Salad
recipes.description: Spiced carrot and chickpea salad with lemon dressing.
instructions: In a bowl, combine carrots, chickpeas, raisins, and parsley.
Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: American Classic Mac and Cheese
recipes.description: Creamy baked macaroni with cheddar cheese.
instructions: Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Melt butter in a saucepan. Whisk in flour to make a roux.
Gradually add milk, whisking until smooth. Cook until thickened.
Stir in cheese, mustard, salt, and pepper until melted.
Combine cheese sauce with macaroni. Transfer to a baking dish.
Top with breadcrumbs. Bake for 20 minutes until bubbly and golden.

recipes.name: Spanish Patatas Bravas
recipes.description: Crispy potatoes with spicy tomato sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Toss potatoes with olive oil and salt. Roast for 25-30 minutes until crispy.
For the sauce, sauté onion and garlic until soft. Add tomatoes, paprika, cayenne, and salt. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve potatoes topped with the spicy sauce and garnished with parsley.

recipes.name: Turkish Menemen
recipes.description: Scrambled eggs with tomatoes, peppers, and spices.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and green pepper. Sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes, paprika, chili flakes (if using), salt, and pepper. Cook until tomatoes break down and form a sauce, about 8-10 minutes.
Crack the eggs directly into the skillet. Do not scramble first.
Gently stir the eggs into the tomato mixture with a wooden spoon, cooking until eggs are just set but still slightly creamy, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove from heat. Garnish with fresh parsley and crumbled feta if desired.
Serve immediately directly from the skillet with crusty bread for dipping.

recipes.name: Indonesian Gado-Gado
recipes.description: Indonesian salad with peanut sauce dressing.
ingredients: 2 cups green beans, trimmed and halved
1 block firm tofu, pan-fried and cubed
1/2 tsp chili paste (sambal oelek) or to taste
instructions: Blanch the green beans and carrots in boiling water for 2-3 minutes until crisp-tender. Immediately plunge into ice water to stop cooking. Drain well.
Arrange all vegetables, eggs, and tofu on a large serving platter.
To make the peanut sauce, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger in a bowl.
Gradually add warm water, whisking until you achieve a smooth, pourable consistency.
Stir in chili paste to taste.
Drizzle the peanut sauce over the salad or serve on the side.
Toss gently just before eating.

recipes.name: Canadian Tourtière
recipes.description: Savory French-Canadian meat pie for holidays.
instructions: In a large skillet, cook ground beef and lamb over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain excess fat.
Add onion and garlic, cooking until softened, about 5 minutes.

Stir in beef broth, thyme, sage, cloves, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Let the filling cool completely.
Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Line a pie dish with one pie crust. Fill with the cooled meat mixture.
Cover with the second pie crust. Crimp the edges to seal. Cut a few slits in the top to vent.
Brush the top crust with the beaten egg.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
Let the pie rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Lebanese Lemon Garlic Chicken (Tawook)
recipes.description: Marinated grilled chicken skewers with garlic sauce.
ingredients: 1.5 kg boneless, skinless chicken thighs (halal), cut into chunks
For serving: pita bread, garlic sauce (toum), pickles, fries
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, tomato paste, paprika, coriander, salt, and pepper.
Add the chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they are fully coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight.
If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for 30 minutes before grilling.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers.
Grill the skewers for 5-7 minutes per side, or until the chicken is cooked through and has nice grill marks.
Serve the chicken skewers wrapped in warm pita bread with garlic sauce, pickles, and fries on the side.

recipes.name: West African Peanut Stew
recipes.description: Rich and hearty stew with sweet potatoes and peanuts.
ingredients: 2 tbsp peanut oil or vegetable oil
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add sweet potato, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, peanut butter, cumin, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Stir until the peanut butter is dissolved.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until the sweet potato is tender.
Stir in the kale or spinach and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes.
Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve hot over cooked rice, garnished with chopped peanuts.

recipes.name: German Potato Salad (Kartoffelsalat)
recipes.description: Warm potato salad with bacon and vinegar dressing.
ingredients: 200g bacon (halal substitute: turkey bacon or smoked tofu), diced
instructions: Place whole, unpeeled potatoes in a large pot of salted water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 20-25 minutes. Drain and let cool slightly before peeling and slicing into 1/4-inch rounds.
In a large skillet, cook the diced bacon until crispy. Remove with a slotted spoon, leaving the fat in the pan.
Add the chopped onion to the bacon fat and cook over medium heat until softened, about 5 minutes.
Whisk in the broth, vinegar, mustard, sugar, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer.
Add the sliced warm potatoes and cooked bacon to the skillet. Gently toss to coat in the warm dressing.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, allowing the potatoes to absorb the flavors. Stir in the fresh chives.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Sri Lankan Coconut Sambal (Pol Sambol)
recipes.description: Spicy coconut relish, a staple Sri Lankan condiment.
ingredients: 4-6 dried red chilies, soaked in hot water and drained
1 tbsp Maldive fish (optional, omit for vegan)
instructions: If using dried coconut, place it in a bowl and add a few tablespoons of warm water to moisten it slightly. Let it sit for 5 minutes.
In a food processor or using a mortar and pestle, combine the soaked chilies, red onion, garlic, and Maldive fish (if using). Grind into a coarse paste.
Add the moistened coconut and pound or pulse a few times to combine. Do not over-process; it should remain textured.
Transfer to a bowl. Stir in lime juice and salt to taste.
Serve as a condiment with rice, curry, or flatbread. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

recipes.name: Argentinian Chimichurri Sauce
recipes.description: Vibrant green herb sauce for grilled meats.
ingredients: 1 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley, firmly packed
instructions: Finely chop the parsley, oregano, and garlic together. Alternatively, pulse them a few times in a food processor, but be careful not to puree.
Transfer the chopped herbs to a bowl.
Whisk in the olive oil, red wine vinegar, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
Let the sauce sit at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve generously over grilled steak, chicken, or fish. Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to a week.

recipes.name: Korean Beef Bulgogi
recipes.description: Sweet and savory marinated grilled beef slices.
ingredients: 500g beef sirloin or ribeye (halal), thinly sliced
1/2 Asian pear, grated (or 1/4 cup apple juice)
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together grated pear, soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, green onions, sesame seeds, and pepper.
Add the thinly sliced beef to the marinade, ensuring each piece is coated. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator.
Heat a tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Working in batches, add the marinated beef in a single layer. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side until caramelized and cooked through.
Serve immediately with steamed rice and lettuce leaves for wrapping (ssam).

recipes.name: Italian Panna Cotta
recipes.description: Silky vanilla custard with berry compote.
instructions: Lightly grease 6 ramekins or molds with a neutral oil.
In a small bowl, sprinkle the gelatin over the cold water. Let it bloom for 5-10 minutes.
In a saucepan, heat the cream and sugar over medium heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves and the mixture is hot but not boiling. Remove from heat.
Whisk the bloomed gelatin into the hot cream until completely dissolved. Stir in the vanilla extract.
Divide the mixture evenly among the prepared ramekins. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or until set.
For the compote, combine berries, sugar, and lemon juice in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 5-7 minutes, until the berries break down and the sauce thickens slightly. Let it cool.
To serve, dip the bottom of each ramekin in warm water for a few seconds. Run a knife around the edge and invert onto a serving plate. Top with the berry compote.

recipes.name: Vietnamese Pho Ga (Chicken Pho)
recipes.description: Aromatic Vietnamese chicken noodle soup.
ingredients: For serving: bean sprouts, Thai basil, lime wedges, sliced chili, hoisin sauce, Sriracha
instructions: Place chicken in large pot and cover with 4 liters water. Bring to boil, skim off any foam.
Char onion and ginger halves over open flame or under broiler until slightly blackened.
Add charred onion, ginger, and all spices (star anise, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, coriander seeds) to pot.
Simmer gently for 1 hour until chicken is cooked through.
Remove chicken from broth and let cool. Strain broth through fine mesh sieve.
Return clear broth to pot, add fish sauce and sugar. Season with salt if needed.
Shred chicken meat, discarding skin and bones.
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and divide among bowls.
Top noodles with shredded chicken. Ladle hot broth over top.
Serve immediately with bean sprouts, herbs, lime, and condiments on the side.

recipes.name: Greek Moussaka
recipes.description: Layered eggplant and potato casserole with meat sauce.
instructions: Salt eggplant slices and let sit 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.
Fry eggplant and potato slices in olive oil until golden. Drain on paper towels.
Sauté onion until soft. Add garlic and ground beef. Cook until browned.
Add tomatoes, wine, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt and pepper. Simmer 30 minutes.
Make béchamel: Melt butter, whisk in flour. Gradually add milk, whisking until thick. Remove from heat, stir in eggs and half the cheese.
Layer potatoes in baking dish, then eggplant, then meat sauce. Pour béchamel over top.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 45 minutes until golden.
Let rest 15 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Jamaican Jerk Chicken
recipes.description: Spicy grilled chicken with Caribbean jerk seasoning.
instructions: Combine all ingredients except chicken in food processor. Blend into smooth paste.
Make deep cuts in chicken. Rub marinade all over chicken, including cuts.
Marinate in refrigerator at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.
Grill over medium heat 30-40 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through.
Serve with rice and peas or festival (sweet fried dough).

recipes.name: Indian Palak Paneer
recipes.description: Creamy spinach curry with Indian cheese cubes.
instructions: Blanch spinach in boiling water 2 minutes. Drain and blend to smooth puree.
Heat ghee. Fry paneer until golden. Remove and set aside.
Temper cumin seeds. Add onion, cook until golden.
Add ginger-garlic-chili paste. Cook 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, salt. Cook until tomatoes break down.
Add spinach puree. Simmer 10 minutes.
Add garam masala, cream, and fried paneer. Simmer 5 minutes.
Serve with naan or rice.

recipes.name: French Coq au Vin
recipes.description: Classic French chicken braised in red wine sauce.
instructions: Brown chicken pieces in butter. Remove and set aside.
Sauté bacon until crispy. Add pearl onions and mushrooms, cook until browned.
Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Sprinkle flour, cook 2 minutes.
Add wine, stock, tomato paste, bouquet garni. Bring to boil.
Return chicken to pot. Cover and simmer 1 hour until chicken tender.
Remove chicken. Reduce sauce until thickened.
Return chicken to sauce. Serve with mashed potatoes.

recipes.name: Thai Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad)
recipes.description: Spicy green papaya salad with peanuts and lime.
instructions: Pound garlic and chilies in mortar until crushed.
Add palm sugar, fish sauce, lime juice. Mix well.
Add tomato, long beans, dried shrimp. Pound lightly.
Add shredded papaya. Toss with dressing.
Top with peanuts. Serve with lime wedges.

recipes.name: Mexican Chiles en Nogada
recipes.description: Poblano peppers stuffed with meat and fruit.
instructions: Roast peppers until blistered. Steam in bag 15 minutes. Peel carefully.
Sauté onion and garlic. Add beef, cook until browned.
Add fruits, nuts, raisins, cinnamon. Cook 10 minutes.
Make nogada sauce: Blend soaked walnuts, cream, milk until smooth.
Stuff peppers with meat mixture. Top with nogada sauce.
Garnish with pomegranate seeds and parsley.

recipes.name: Lebanese Kibbeh
recipes.description: Fried bulgur and meat croquettes with pine nuts.
instructions: Soak bulgur in water 30 minutes. Drain well.
Mix half the meat with soaked bulgur, grated onion, spices. Knead well.
For filling: Sauté chopped onion in butter. Add remaining meat, pine nuts, cook until browned.
Form kibbeh shells: Take portion of bulgur mixture, hollow out, fill with meat filling, seal.
Shape into football shapes. Fry in hot oil until golden.
Serve with yogurt or tahini sauce.

recipes.name: Japanese Okonomiyaki
recipes.description: Savory Japanese cabbage pancake with toppings.
instructions: Mix flour, eggs, dashi to make batter.
Add shredded cabbage. Mix gently.
Pour onto hot griddle. Top with bacon slices.
Cook 5 minutes per side until golden.
Drizzle with okonomiyaki sauce and mayonnaise.
Top with bonito flakes and aonori.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Moroccan Pastilla (B'stilla)
recipes.description: Sweet and savory pigeon or chicken pie with almonds.
ingredients: Powdered sugar and cinnamon for dusting
instructions: Cook chicken with onions, spices until tender. Shred meat.
Reduce cooking liquid. Add eggs, scramble until thick.
Toast almonds with sugar and orange blossom water.
Layer phyllo in pan, brushing with butter between layers.
Add chicken, egg mixture, almonds. Top with more phyllo.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) 30 minutes until golden.
Dust with powdered sugar and cinnamon before serving.

recipes.name: Authentic Italian Osso Buco
recipes.description: Braised veal shanks with vegetables and white wine.
ingredients: 4 pieces veal shank (osso buco cut, about 3cm thick)
1 can (400g) whole plum tomatoes, crushed by hand
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
For Gremolata: 1/4 cup fresh parsley, finely chopped, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 1 tbsp lemon zest
instructions: Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). Pat the veal shanks completely dry with paper towels. This is crucial for achieving a good sear.
Season the veal shanks generously on all sides with salt and pepper. Dredge each shank in the flour, shaking off any excess.

In a large, heavy-bottomed Dutch oven or oven-proof pot, heat the olive oil and 2 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, add the veal shanks and sear for about 4-5 minutes on each side, until a deep golden-brown crust forms. Do not crowd the pot; work in batches if necessary. Remove the shanks and set them aside on a plate.

Reduce the heat to medium. Add the remaining butter to the pot. Add the diced onion, carrots, and celery (this mix is called a soffritto). Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 8-10 minutes, until the vegetables have softened but not browned.
Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Pour in the white wine to deglaze the pot, using a wooden spoon to scrape up all the browned bits from the bottom. Let the wine simmer for 3-4 minutes until it has reduced by about half.
Add the crushed tomatoes, chicken stock, bay leaves, lemon zest, and thyme sprigs. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
Carefully return the veal shanks to the pot, along with any accumulated juices. The liquid should come about halfway up the sides of the meat. If it doesn't, add a bit more stock.

Cover the pot with a lid and transfer it to the preheated oven. Braise for 2 to 2.5 hours, turning the shanks once halfway through, until the meat is extremely tender and easily pulls apart with a fork.
While the osso buco cooks, make the gremolata by combining the chopped parsley, minced garlic, and lemon zest in a small bowl.
Once cooked, carefully remove the pot from the oven. Using tongs, transfer the veal shanks to a serving platter and cover with foil to keep warm.
