Add tomatoes and spice powders (turmeric, coriander, red chili). Cook until tomatoes soften.
Add grated radish and salt. Mix well and cook covered for 15-20 minutes on medium heat.
Stir occasionally until radish is cooked and moisture evaporates.
Sprinkle garam masala and coriander leaves. Serve hot with paratha.

recipes.name: Menemen
recipes.description: Turkish scrambled eggs with tomatoes, peppers, and herbs.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent (3-4 minutes).
Add diced bell pepper and cook until softened (5 minutes).
Stir in chopped tomatoes, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes.
Cook until tomatoes break down and form a sauce (8-10 minutes).
Crack eggs directly into the skillet and gently scramble into the vegetable mixture.
Cook until eggs are set but still moist (3-4 minutes).
Sprinkle with parsley and feta cheese. Serve immediately with crusty bread.

recipes.name: Tavuk Şiş
recipes.description: Grilled chicken skewers marinated in yogurt and spices.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken breast, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: Soak wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes to prevent burning.
In a bowl, mix yogurt, olive oil, grated onion, garlic, tomato paste, and spices.
Add chicken cubes to the marinade, coat thoroughly, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Thread marinated chicken onto skewers, leaving small spaces between pieces.
Preheat grill or broiler to medium-high heat.
Grill skewers for 5-7 minutes per side until chicken is cooked through and slightly charred.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice over skewers before serving with rice or salad.

recipes.name: Mercimek Çorbasi
recipes.description: Creamy red lentil soup with vegetables and spices.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent (5 minutes).
Add garlic, carrot, and potato. Cook for 5 more minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook 1 minute.
Add rinsed lentils and broth. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes until lentils and vegetables are tender.
Blend soup with immersion blender until smooth and creamy.
Serve hot with lemon wedges and fresh mint garnish.

recipes.name: Pirinç Pilavi
recipes.description: Simple Turkish rice pilaf with butter and orzo.
instructions: Rinse rice in cold water until water runs clear. Drain well.
Melt butter and olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add orzo and sauté until golden brown (2-3 minutes).
Add rinsed rice and stir to coat with butter (2 minutes).
Pour in broth, add salt, pepper, and dried mint. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand covered for 10 minutes.
Fluff with fork before serving. Serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Gözleme
recipes.description: Stuffed flatbread with spinach and feta filling.
instructions: Mix flour and salt in a bowl. Gradually add warm water and olive oil.
Knead for 5-7 minutes until smooth dough forms. Cover and rest for 30 minutes.
Sauté onion in oil until soft. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Cool.
Mix spinach mixture with feta, dill, and pepper for filling.
Divide dough into 4 equal balls. Roll each into thin circle.
Spread filling on half of each circle. Fold other half over and seal edges.
Cook on lightly greased griddle or skillet over medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side.
Brush with butter before serving. Cut into triangles.

recipes.name: Patlıcan Ezmesi
recipes.description: Smoky eggplant dip with garlic and lemon juice.
instructions: Prick eggplants with fork and char over open flame or under broiler.
Turn occasionally until skin is blackened and flesh is soft (15-20 minutes).
Place charred eggplants in bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and cool for 15 minutes.
Peel off blackened skin and discard. Drain excess liquid from flesh.
Chop eggplant flesh and place in bowl. Mash with fork.
Add garlic, tahini, lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Mix well until smooth and creamy. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Chill for 1 hour. Garnish with parsley and pomegranate seeds. Serve with bread.

recipes.name: Yoğurtlu Havuç
recipes.description: Cooked carrots with garlic yogurt sauce and herbs.
instructions: Steam or boil carrot slices until tender but firm (8-10 minutes). Drain and cool.
Mix yogurt, minced garlic, and salt in a bowl. Set aside.
Heat olive oil in small pan. Add dried mint and paprika. Cook for 30 seconds.
Arrange cooked carrots on serving plate. Spread yogurt sauce over top.
Drizzle with mint-infused oil and sprinkle with black pepper.
Garnish with chopped walnuts and fresh dill.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Can be served cold or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Afghan Qabuli Palau
recipes.description: Fragrant rice with tender lamb, carrots, and raisins.
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, rinsed and soaked 30 mins
1 lb lamb shoulder, cut into chunks
instructions: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a large pot. Brown lamb pieces on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In same pot, sauté onions until golden. Add spices and cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Return lamb to pot, add water/stock. Cover and simmer for 1 hour until lamb is tender.
In separate pan, heat remaining oil. Fry carrots until softened. Add raisins and sugar, cook 2 more minutes. Set aside.
Drain soaked rice. Layer cooked lamb, rice, and carrot-raisin mixture in pot.
Add enough water to cover rice by 1 inch. Cover and cook on low for 25 minutes.
Let rest 10 minutes before fluffing. Garnish with almonds and serve.

recipes.name: Mantu
recipes.description: Steamed dumplings filled with spiced meat and onions.
instructions: Mix ground meat, grated onion, garlic, and spices. Drain excess liquid.
Place 1 tbsp filling in center of each wrapper. Moisten edges with water.
Bring opposite corners together and pinch to seal, creating a pyramid shape.
Place dumplings in steamer basket lined with parchment (brush with oil to prevent sticking).
Steam for 40 minutes until cooked through.
Mix yogurt with minced garlic and salt for sauce.
Arrange dumplings on plate, top with yogurt sauce. Sprinkle with mint and paprika.
Drizzle with tomato sauce if desired.

recipes.name: Afghan Chicken Korma
recipes.description: Chicken in rich tomato-based sauce with Afghan spices.
instructions: Heat oil in large pot. Brown chicken pieces on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In same oil, sauté onions until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger, cook 1 minute.
Add all spices and tomato paste. Cook 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates (about 10 minutes).
Whisk yogurt with a little water until smooth. Gradually add to sauce, stirring constantly.
Return chicken to pot. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes until chicken is tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Borani Banjan
recipes.description: Layered eggplant with tomatoes and garlic yogurt sauce.
instructions: Sprinkle eggplant slices with salt and let sit 20 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.
Heat oil in pan. Fry eggplant slices until golden on both sides. Drain on paper towels.
In same pan, sauté onions until soft. Add spices and cook 1 minute.
Layer eggplant, tomato slices, and onion mixture in baking dish.
Cover and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20 minutes.
Mix yogurt with minced garlic, salt, and half the mint.
Spread yogurt sauce over cooked eggplant. Sprinkle with remaining mint and paprika.
Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Afghan Shorwa
recipes.description: Hearty lamb and vegetable soup with Afghan spices.
ingredients: 1 lb lamb or beef, cut into chunks
instructions: Heat oil in large pot. Brown meat pieces on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onions until translucent. Add spices and cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Return meat to pot. Add water and bring to boil. Skim off any foam.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 1 hour until meat is tender.
Add vegetables and split peas. Simmer for another 30 minutes until vegetables are soft.
Adjust seasoning. Soup should be thick and hearty.
Garnish with dried mint and fresh cilantro. Serve with lemon wedges and naan.

recipes.name: Naan-e-Afghani
recipes.description: Soft Afghan flatbread baked in traditional tandoor style.
ingredients: 2 tbsp nigella seeds or sesame seeds (optional)
instructions: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let sit 10 minutes until foamy.
In large bowl, mix flour and salt. Make well in center.
Add yeast mixture, warm milk, and oil. Knead for 10 minutes until smooth elastic dough.
Place in oiled bowl, cover, and let rise 1 hour until doubled.
Punch down dough. Divide into 8 equal pieces. Roll into oval shapes about 1/4 inch thick.
Press fingertips to create characteristic indentations on surface.
Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with seeds if using.
Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 8-10 minutes until puffed and golden.
Brush with melted butter immediately after baking. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Salata
recipes.description: Fresh Afghan tomato and cucumber salad with herbs.
instructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumbers, onion, and bell pepper in large bowl.
Add chopped mint and cilantro. Toss gently.
In small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Sprinkle with sumac if using.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Serve with lemon wedges on the side. Perfect accompaniment to grilled meats.

recipes.name: Bibimbap
recipes.description: Korean mixed rice bowl with vegetables and halal beef.
instructions: Marinate beef with 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp sugar, 1 clove minced garlic, and 1 tsp sesame oil for 15 minutes.
Blanch spinach and bean sprouts separately in boiling water for 1 minute each. Drain and squeeze out excess water.
Season spinach with sesame oil and salt. Season bean sprouts with sesame oil and minced garlic.
Sauté each vegetable separately in a little oil until tender but still crisp. Season lightly with salt.
Cook marinated beef in a pan until browned and cooked through.
Fry eggs sunny-side up or to preference.
Arrange rice in bowls, top with arranged vegetables and beef. Place fried egg in center.
Serve with gochujang and extra sesame oil on the side. Mix before eating.

recipes.name: Bulgogi
recipes.description: Sweet and savory marinated grilled halal beef.
ingredients: 600g halal beef sirloin or ribeye, thinly sliced
instructions: Freeze beef for 30 minutes to make slicing easier. Cut into very thin slices.
In a bowl, mix grated pear, onion, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, and pepper.
Add beef to marinade, ensuring all pieces are coated. Marinate for at least 30 minutes or overnight.
Heat oil in a skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Add marinated beef and optional vegetables if using. Cook for 4-5 minutes until beef is cooked through and slightly caramelized.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions. Serve with rice and side dishes.

recipes.name: Dak Gui
recipes.description: Korean grilled chicken marinated in soy and spices.
ingredients: 1 tbsp rice wine or apple juice
instructions: Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces or leave whole as preferred.
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, rice wine, grated onion, garlic, ginger, sesame oil, and pepper.
Add chicken to marinade, coat thoroughly. Marinate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Heat grill or grill pan over medium heat. Brush with oil to prevent sticking.
Grill chicken for 6-8 minutes per side until cooked through and slightly charred.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds. Serve with rice and kimchi.

recipes.name: Kimchi Bokkeumbap
recipes.description: Spicy kimchi fried rice with canned tuna option.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Sauté onion until translucent. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add kimchi and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
Add tuna if using, breaking it up with a spoon. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add gochujang, soy sauce, and sugar. Mix well.
Add rice and break up any clumps. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until everything is well combined and rice is heated through.
Drizzle with sesame oil and mix. Garnish with green onions.
Fry eggs sunny-side up and place on top of rice. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and nori if using.

recipes.name: Tteokbokki
recipes.description: Spicy Korean rice cakes, vegetarian option available.
instructions: Soak rice cakes in warm water for 15-20 minutes if they are hard.
In a pot, combine stock, gochujang, gochugaru, soy sauce, sugar, and garlic. Bring to a simmer.
Add onion and rice cakes. Cook for 8-10 minutes until rice cakes are soft and sauce has thickened.
Add fish cakes if using and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Add green onions and sesame oil. Stir to combine.
Serve hot garnished with sesame seeds. Add hard-boiled eggs if desired.

recipes.name: Japchae
recipes.description: Stir-fried glass noodles with vegetables and halal beef.
instructions: Cook noodles according to package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Cut into shorter lengths with scissors.
Marinate beef with 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1/2 tbsp sugar, 1 clove minced garlic, and pepper for 15 minutes.
Blanch spinach briefly in boiling water, drain and squeeze out excess water. Season with a little sesame oil.
Heat oil in a wok or large pan. Sauté each vegetable separately until tender but still crisp. Set aside.
Cook marinated beef until browned. Set aside.
In the same pan, combine noodles, remaining soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add all cooked vegetables and beef to the noodles. Toss gently to combine.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Gyeran Mari
recipes.description: Korean rolled omelette with vegetables.
ingredients: 2 tbsp red bell pepper, finely diced
instructions: Beat eggs with milk, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Stir in diced vegetables and nori if using.
Heat oil in a rectangular omelette pan or small non-stick skillet over medium-low heat.
Pour a thin layer of egg mixture to cover the bottom of the pan. Cook until set but still slightly wet on top.
Carefully roll the omelette from one side to the other. Push to one end of the pan.
Pour another thin layer of egg mixture, lifting the rolled omelette to let uncooked egg flow underneath.
When new layer is set, roll again, incorporating the new layer. Repeat until all egg mixture is used.
Remove from pan and let cool slightly. Slice into 1-inch pieces. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Kimchi Jeon
recipes.description: Savory kimchi pancake, perfect as snack or appetizer.
ingredients: 1 cup kimchi, chopped with 2 tbsp juice
Dipping sauce: 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp vinegar, 1 tsp sesame seeds, 1/2 tsp gochugaru
instructions: In a bowl, combine flour, kimchi juice/water, and egg. Mix until smooth.
Add chopped kimchi, green onions, onion, gochugaru (if using), salt, and sugar. Mix well.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour batter into pan, spreading evenly to form a round pancake. Cook for 4-5 minutes until bottom is golden and crisp.
Flip carefully and cook other side for 3-4 minutes, adding more oil if needed.
Repeat with remaining batter if making multiple pancakes.
Mix dipping sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
Cut pancake into wedges and serve hot with dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Dubu Jorim
recipes.description: Braised tofu in savory soy sauce marinade.
ingredients: Thin slices of carrot or pepper for garnish (optional)
instructions: Drain tofu and pat dry with paper towels. Cut into 1/2-inch thick slices.
Heat vegetable oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pan-fry tofu slices until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, combine soy sauce, water, sugar, garlic, and gochugaru. Bring to a simmer.
Add fried tofu back to the pan. Spoon sauce over tofu. Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce reduces and thickens.
Add sesame oil and gently toss to coat.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds. Serve warm with rice.

recipes.name: Kongnamul Muchim
recipes.description: Seasoned soybean sprouts salad, simple and refreshing.
instructions: Rinse soybean sprouts in cold water. Remove any brown husks or spoiled sprouts.
Bring a pot of water to boil. Add sprouts and cook for 4-5 minutes until tender but still crisp.
Drain immediately and rinse with cold water to stop cooking. Drain well.
In a bowl, combine garlic, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, sesame seeds, gochugaru (if using), salt, and pepper.
Add drained sprouts to the seasoning mixture. Toss gently to combine.
Adjust seasoning to taste. Can be served immediately or chilled for later.
Garnish with extra sesame seeds before serving.

recipes.name: Kabsa
recipes.description: The national dish of Saudi Arabia, featuring fragrant spiced rice with tender, flavorful chicken.
ingredients: 3 cups basmati rice, rinsed and soaked for 15 minutes
3 tbsp Kabsa spice blend (or mix: 1 tsp each black pepper, cardamom, cumin, coriander, paprika; 1/2 tsp cinnamon, saffron threads)
Toasted almonds and pine nuts for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add the chicken pieces and brown on all sides for about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in the tomato paste, pureed tomatoes, Kabsa spices, bay leaves, and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and let the chicken simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until cooked through.
Remove the chicken pieces and set aside. Strain the cooking broth and measure it. You will need 4.5 cups of broth for the rice (add water if necessary).
Return the 4.5 cups of broth to the pot and bring to a boil. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the boiling broth.
Reduce heat to very low, cover the pot tightly, and let the rice cook for 20-25 minutes, or until all liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender.
While the rice is cooking, you can brown the cooked chicken pieces under a broiler or in a pan for a few minutes for a crispier skin.
To serve, fluff the rice with a fork and place it on a large platter. Arrange the chicken pieces on top and garnish with toasted almonds and pine nuts.

recipes.name: Mandi
recipes.description: A famous fragrant rice dish from the Hijaz region, known for its tender, falling-off-the-bone meat and aromatic flavor.
ingredients: 1 kg lamb shoulder or shank (on the bone)
3 cups basmati rice, rinsed and soaked
2 tbsp Mandi spice blend (or mix: 2 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp cardamom, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1/2 tsp cloves, 1/2 tsp cinnamon)
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil. Add the sliced onions and cook until soft and translucent.
Add the lamb pieces and brown on all sides. Add the minced garlic, Mandi spices, and salt. Stir to coat the meat.
Pour in the water or broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the meat is very tender.
Remove the cooked meat and set aside. Strain the cooking liquid and measure 4.5 cups for the rice.
In the same pot, melt the ghee. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot, stirring for a minute.
Pour the 4.5 cups of reserved cooking liquid over the rice. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to the lowest setting, cover tightly, and cook for 20-25 minutes.

For the authentic smoky flavor (optional): Place the cooked meat on top of the rice. Heat a piece of charcoal directly on a flame until red-hot. Place it in a small metal bowl on top of the meat. Quickly drizzle a teaspoon of oil over the charcoal and immediately cover the pot tightly. Let it smoke for 5-7 minutes before removing the charcoal and bowl.
Fluff the rice, arrange the meat on top, and garnish with fried almonds and raisins.

recipes.name: Saleeg
recipes.description: A creamy and comforting white rice porridge from the Taif region, traditionally made with chicken and served with a flavorful tomato sauce.
ingredients: Salt and white pepper to taste
instructions: Place the chicken, onion, garlic, bay leaves, cardamom, and cinnamon stick in a large pot. Cover with water (about 8-10 cups).
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour, until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Remove the chicken from the broth. Strain the broth into another pot; you should have about 6 cups. Discard the solids.
Shred the chicken meat, discarding the skin and bones.

Bring the strained broth to a simmer. Add the rice and cook on low heat, stirring frequently, for about 20-25 minutes until the rice is very soft and has broken down, creating a porridge-like consistency.
Stir in the milk and cream. Continue to cook on low for another 10 minutes, stirring often to prevent sticking. The Saleeg should be thick and creamy.
Season generously with salt and white pepper.
To serve, pour the creamy Saleeg into a deep dish, make a well in the center, and place the shredded chicken and a generous dollop of butter in the center.

recipes.name: Shakshuka
recipes.description: A popular breakfast across the Arab world, featuring eggs poached in a rich, spiced tomato and pepper sauce.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Fresh parsley or cilantro, chopped for garnish
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and bell pepper and cook until soft, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Stir in the tomato paste, cumin, paprika, and cayenne. Cook for 1 minute.
Pour in the crushed tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the sauce has thickened.
Using a spoon, create small wells in the sauce. Crack an egg into each well.
Cover the skillet and cook for 5-8 minutes, or until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Garnish with fresh parsley or cilantro and serve immediately with warm bread.

recipes.name: Hummus
recipes.description: A classic, creamy Middle Eastern dip made from chickpeas, tahini, lemon, and garlic. A staple on every Saudi table.
ingredients: 1 can (400g) chickpeas, drained and rinsed (liquid reserved)
2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
instructions: In a food processor, combine the tahini and lemon juice. Process for 1 minute until smooth and whipped.
Add the minced garlic, cumin, and a generous pinch of salt. Process for another 30 seconds.
Add half of the chickpeas and process for 1 minute. Scrape down the sides, then add the remaining chickpeas and process until very smooth, about 1-2 minutes.

With the processor running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil. If the hummus is too thick, slowly add 2-3 tablespoons of the reserved chickpea liquid (aquafaba) until you reach your desired consistency.
Taste and adjust seasoning, adding more salt or lemon juice if needed.
Transfer to a serving bowl, create a swirl on top with a spoon, and drizzle with more olive oil. Sprinkle with paprika and chopped parsley.

recipes.name: Mutabbaq
recipes.description: A famous street food of stuffed savory pastry, often filled with spiced meat, eggs, and vegetables. This version uses spring roll wrappers for ease.
ingredients: 12 spring roll or egg roll wrappers (halal-certified)
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until soft.
Add the garlic and green chilies, cook for 1 minute. Add the ground meat and cook until browned.
Add all the spices (cumin, coriander, turmeric, black pepper, salt) and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Stir the chopped cilantro into the cooked meat mixture.
Lay a spring roll wrapper on a flat surface. Place 2-3 tablespoons of the meat mixture in the center. Create a small well in the middle and pour in about 1 tablespoon of the beaten egg.
Fold the wrapper over the filling to form a rectangle or triangle, sealing the edges with a little water or egg wash.
Heat oil in a deep pan for shallow frying. Fry the Mutabbaq until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

recipes.name: Foul Medammes
recipes.description: A hearty and nutritious stew of fava beans, typically eaten for breakfast and flavored with lemon, garlic, and olive oil.
ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) fava beans (ful medammes), undrained
3 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
instructions: In a saucepan, combine the canned fava beans with their liquid. Heat over medium heat until simmering.
Use a potato masher or the back of a spoon to lightly mash the beans, leaving some whole for texture.
Add the minced garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, and salt. Stir to combine and simmer for another 5-10 minutes until the flavors meld. Add a little water if it becomes too thick.
Taste and adjust seasoning with more lemon juice or salt if needed.
Serve hot in bowls, drizzled generously with more olive oil and garnished with chopped parsley, tomato, and red onion. Serve with warm pita bread.

recipes.name: Samboosa (Meat)
recipes.description: Crispy, fried triangular pastries filled with a savory mixture of spiced meat and onions. A essential snack for Ramadan and gatherings.
ingredients: 1 package spring roll or samosa wrappers (halal-certified)
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan. Sauté the onion until soft. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the ground meat and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon. Drain any excess fat.
Add the peas (if using) and all spices (cumin, coriander, pepper, cinnamon, salt). Cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in the cilantro. Let the filling cool completely.

Place a wrapper on a flat surface. Place about 1 tablespoon of filling on one end. Fold the corner over the filling to form a triangle, then continue folding in a triangle pattern until the entire wrapper is used. Seal the final edge with a paste made of flour and water.
Heat oil in a deep pan to 350°F (175°C). Fry the samboosas in batches until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with a dipping sauce like mint yogurt or tamarind chutney.

recipes.name: Shorabat Adas (Lentil Soup)
recipes.description: A simple, comforting, and protein-packed lentil soup, commonly enjoyed especially during Ramadan to break the fast.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and carrot and cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the garlic, cumin, and turmeric. Cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add the rinsed lentils and broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until the lentils and vegetables are very tender.
Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth. (Alternatively, let it cool slightly and blend in batches in a countertop blender).
Return the soup to the pot if needed. Stir in the lemon juice and season generously with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and fresh herbs.

recipes.name: Balaleet
recipes.description: A unique and beloved sweet and savory dish of vermicelli noodles cooked with sugar, rose water, and cardamom, topped with a fluffy omelet.
ingredients: 200g vermicelli noodles, broken into small pieces
1/4 tsp saffron threads (soaked in 1 tbsp water, optional)
Slivered almonds or pistachios for garnish
instructions: Cook the vermicelli noodles according to package directions (usually boiling for 3-4 mins). Drain well.
In a large pan, melt 2 tbsp of ghee over medium heat. Add the drained noodles and sauté for 2 minutes.
Reduce heat to low. Add the sugar, cardamom, and saffron water (if using). Stir continuously for 3-4 minutes until the sugar melts and coats the noodles.
Stir in the rose water. Keep the sweet noodles warm.
In a bowl, beat the eggs with a pinch of turmeric and a pinch of salt.
In a separate non-stick pan, melt the remaining 1 tbsp of ghee. Pour in the eggs and cook until set into a flat omelet.
To serve, place a portion of the sweet vermicelli on a plate and top it with a quarter of the omelet. Garnish with slivered almonds or pistachios.

recipes.name: Madhbi
recipes.description: A traditional grilled chicken dish from the southern region of Najran. The chicken is marinated with simple spices and cooked over hot stones or a grill for a smoky flavor.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the grated onion, crushed garlic, black pepper, salt, turmeric, yogurt, lemon juice, and olive oil to form a marinade.
Add the chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring each piece is thoroughly coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight.
Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. If using charcoal, wait until the coals are white-hot.
Remove the chicken from the marinade, shaking off any excess. Reserve the marinade.
Grill the chicken pieces for 30-40 minutes, turning occasionally, until fully cooked and the skin is crispy and charred in spots.
While grilling, baste the chicken with the reserved marinade for the first 15 minutes only (to ensure the raw chicken juices cook off).
Serve the grilled chicken hot with plain long-grain rice to absorb the delicious juices.

recipes.name: Jareesh
recipes.description: A savory and comforting porridge made from cracked wheat and slow-cooked meat, often chicken or lamb. It has a unique, slightly sour flavor and creamy texture.
ingredients: 2 cups jareesh (cracked wheat), rinsed and soaked for 1 hour
500g chicken thighs or lamb, cut into chunks
instructions: In a large pot, melt the ghee over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent.
Add the chicken or lamb pieces and brown on all sides.
Add the minced garlic, black pepper, cumin, cardamom, and salt. Stir for a minute until fragrant.
Drain the soaked jareesh and add it to the pot. Stir to combine with the meat and spices.

Pour in the water or broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to the lowest setting, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 2.5 to 3 hours. Stir every 20-30 minutes to prevent sticking, adding more water if it becomes too thick.
The jareesh is done when the wheat is very soft and has a porridge-like consistency, and the meat is falling apart.
Stir in the lemon juice. Adjust seasoning with more salt and pepper if needed.
Serve hot in bowls, garnished with fried onions.

recipes.name: Mutabbal
recipes.description: A smoky, creamy dip made from roasted eggplant, tahini, and yogurt. It's a staple mezze dish across the Middle East.
ingredients: 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
Pomegranate seeds and fresh parsley for garnish
instructions: Preheat your oven's broiler (or grill on an open flame). Prick the eggplants all over with a fork.

Place the eggplants on a baking sheet and broil for 20-30 minutes, turning occasionally, until the skin is charred and blistered and the flesh is very soft. Alternatively, roast directly over a gas flame for 10-15 minutes.
Place the charred eggplants in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let them steam for 10 minutes—this makes peeling easier.
Once cool enough to handle, peel off the charred skin and discard. Place the soft flesh in a colander to drain any excess liquid for 5 minutes.
In a food processor, combine the eggplant flesh, tahini, yogurt, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and cumin (if using). Pulse until smooth.
Taste and adjust seasoning, adding more lemon juice or salt as needed.
Transfer to a serving bowl, drizzle with more olive oil, and garnish with pomegranate seeds and parsley. Serve with warm pita bread.

recipes.name: Khobz (Arabic Flatbread)
recipes.description: A soft, pillowy, and simple-to-make flatbread that is perfect for scooping up dips, stews, and grilled meats.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, instant yeast, sugar, and salt.
Make a well in the center and add the warm water, yogurt, and olive oil. Mix with a spoon until a shaggy dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead for 8-10 minutes, until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, turn to coat, and cover with a damp cloth. Let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and divide it into 8 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a smooth ball.
On a floured surface, roll each ball into a circle about 1/4 inch thick.
Prick the surface all over with a fork to prevent puffing. Sprinkle with sesame seeds if desired and gently press them in.
Heat a large, dry skillet or griddle over medium heat. Cook each bread for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown spots appear.
Keep cooked bread wrapped in a clean kitchen towel to stay soft and warm until serving.

recipes.name: Hininy
recipes.description: A simple, traditional dessert from the Qassim region made primarily from dates and whole wheat bread, symbolizing hospitality and simplicity.
ingredients: 4 thick slices of whole wheat bread, toasted and broken into pieces
1/4 cup toasted almonds or walnuts, chopped (for garnish)
instructions: In a saucepan, combine the chopped dates and water. Bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the dates have completely broken down and formed a thick, smooth paste. Add a little more water if it becomes too thick.
Stir in the ghee and cardamom powder until the ghee is fully melted and incorporated.
Add the pieces of toasted whole wheat bread to the date mixture. Stir gently until the bread has softened and absorbed most of the date paste, creating a thick, cohesive mixture.
Remove from heat. Serve warm in small bowls, garnished with chopped toasted nuts.

recipes.name: Chelo Kabab Koobideh
recipes.description: Persian minced meat kababs served with saffron rice.
instructions: Grate onion and squeeze out excess liquid. Mix with ground meat.
Add garlic, turmeric, sumac, salt, and pepper. Knead for 5 minutes.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Soak saffron in 2 tbsp hot water. Cook rice according to package instructions.
Form meat mixture around flat skewers into long kababs.
Grill kababs over medium heat for 5-7 minutes each side.
Grill tomatoes alongside kababs until softened.
Serve kababs over rice with grilled tomatoes, butter, and saffron water.
Optional: Top each serving with a raw egg yolk.

recipes.name: Zereshk Polo ba Morgh
recipes.description: Barberry rice with saffron chicken and almonds.
instructions: Rinse and soak rice for 30 minutes. Soak barberries in water for 15 minutes.
Season chicken with turmeric, salt, and pepper. Brown in oil with onions.
Add 2 cups water, cover and simmer for 30 minutes until tender.
Dissolve saffron in 2 tbsp hot water. Drain rice and parboil for 6 minutes.
Layer rice in pot with chicken, drizzle with oil and saffron water.
Cover and cook on low for 45 minutes to create tahdig.
Rinse and drain barberries. Sauté in butter with sugar for 2 minutes.
Toast almonds until golden. Serve rice topped with barberries and almonds.

recipes.name: Tahdig
recipes.description: Crispy golden Persian rice crust with saffron.
ingredients: 1 large potato or 4 tbsp lavash bread
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear. Soak in salted water for 1 hour.
Bring large pot of water to boil. Parboil rice for 6-7 minutes.
Drain rice and rinse with cool water. Dissolve saffron in hot water.
Mix 1 cup rice with yogurt and half the saffron water.
Heat oil and butter in non-stick pot. Add potato slices or lavash.
Spread yogurt-rice mixture over base. Gently pile remaining rice on top.
Make holes in rice with handle of spoon. Drizzle with remaining saffron.
Cover with towel and lid. Cook on high for 5 minutes, then low for 45 minutes.
Invert onto platter to reveal golden crust. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Ghormeh Sabzi
recipes.description: Persian herb stew with kidney beans and meat.
instructions: Chop herbs finely. Sauté in oil until dark green and fragrant.
In separate pot, brown meat with onions and turmeric.
Add sautéed herbs to meat. Add water, pepper, and salt.
Prick dried limes and add to pot. Cover and simmer for 2 hours.
Add cooked kidney beans in last 30 minutes of cooking.
Adjust seasoning and consistency. Stew should be thick and aromatic.
Remove dried limes before serving. Serve over chelo rice.

recipes.name: Fesenjan
recipes.description: Pomegranate walnut stew with chicken or duck.
instructions: Grind walnuts until fine. Sauté in dry pan until fragrant.
Brown chicken pieces in oil with onions. Remove and set aside.
In same pot, toast ground walnuts over low heat for 10 minutes.
Add pomegranate molasses, 2 cups water, sugar, and spices.
Return chicken to pot. Simmer covered for 1.5 hours on low heat.
Sauce should thicken and turn dark brown. Adjust sweet/sour balance.
Garnish with pomegranate seeds. Serve with white rice.

recipes.name: Adas Polo
recipes.description: Persian lentil rice with dates and raisins.
instructions: Rinse and soak rice for 30 minutes. Cook lentils until tender but firm.
Sauté onions until golden. Add dates, raisins, and sugar. Cook until caramelized.
Parboil rice for 6 minutes. Drain and rinse.
Layer rice and lentils in pot. Sprinkle with spices and fried fruit mixture.
Drizzle with oil and melted butter. Add 1/2 cup water.
Cover and cook on low for 45 minutes to create tahdig.
Mix gently before serving. Serve with yogurt or salad.

recipes.name: Kashk-e Bademjan
recipes.description: Creamy Persian eggplant dip with whey and mint.
instructions: Prick eggplants and roast at 400°F (200°C) for 30 minutes until soft.
Cool, peel and mash flesh. Sauté onions until golden brown.
Remove half onions for garnish. Add garlic and turmeric to remaining.
Add mashed eggplant and cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add kashk or yogurt, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Heat 2 tbsp oil, add dried mint and fry for 30 seconds.
Garnish with fried mint, reserved onions, and walnuts.
Serve warm with flatbread or rice.

recipes.name: Mast-o-Khiar
recipes.description: Persian yogurt with cucumber and dried herbs.
instructions: Grate cucumbers and squeeze out excess water.
Whisk yogurt until smooth. Add ice water for desired consistency.
Add cucumbers, herbs, and garlic if using. Mix well.
Season with salt. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Toast walnuts in dry pan until fragrant.
Garnish with raisins, walnuts, and extra herbs before serving.
Serve chilled as side dish or dip with bread.

recipes.name: Kotlet
recipes.description: Persian pan-fried meat and potato patties.
instructions: Grate onion and squeeze out excess liquid.
Mix meat, mashed potatoes, onion, eggs, and spices.
Add baking powder and enough breadcrumbs to bind mixture.
Form into oval patties about 1/2 inch thick.
Heat oil in skillet over medium heat.
Fry kotlet for 3-4 minutes each side until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels. Serve warm with lemon wedges.
Can be served in sandwiches or with rice and salad.

recipes.name: Salad Shirazi
recipes.description: Persian cucumber and tomato salad with mint.
instructions: Dice cucumbers, tomatoes, and onion into similar small pieces.
Combine all vegetables in bowl. Add fresh herbs.
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, dried mint, salt and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Adjust seasoning before serving. Drain excess liquid if necessary.
Serve as refreshing side with grilled meats or rice dishes.
